summary: The concept of "uniform electoral procedure," also referred to as the "European electoral system," pertains to the regulatory framework governing elections within the European Union. This system aims to establish a coherent and standardized approach to electoral procedures across member states, ensuring consistency in voting practices and the safeguarding of democratic principles. By harmonizing electoral regulations, the European electoral system facilitates the effective representation of EU citizens in the European Parliament. This concept is crucial for enhancing transparency, promoting voter participation, and reinforcing the legitimacy of the electoral process within the EU's legal landscape.
